newsitem.title: INDONESIA: At least 10 deaths in Indonesian flooding.
newsitem.headline: At least 10 deaths in Indonesian flooding.

text.p: At least 10 people died and seven were injured in flooding in Indonesia's Central Java province, the Jakarta Post newspaper reported on Tuesday.

The paper said the worst-hit areas were the regencies of Banyumas, Cilacap and Kebumen on the south coast of Java island and the provincial capital Semarang on the north coast where heavy rain has been falling since Friday.

The report quoted local officials as saying four people died in Banyumas, two in Kebumen and one in Cilacap. The three towns are located close together about 350 km (220 miles) southeast of the capital Jakarta.
More than 150 villages were evacuated in this area with more than 5,000 people having to leave their homes.
Three more deaths were reported in the city of Semarang, 400 km (250 miles) east of Jakarta, it said.
